001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003/**
004 * A container class for various interfaces and implementing classes that affect continuous noise, such as that produced
005 * by {@link FastNoise} or {@link SeededNoise}, as well as static utility methods used throughout noise code.
006 * <br>
007 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 3/17/2017.
008 */
009public class Noise {
010    public static final SeededNoise alternate = new SeededNoise(0xFEEDCAFE);
011    /**
012     * Like {@link Math#floor}, but returns a long.
013     * Doesn't consider weird doubles like INFINITY and NaN.
014     *
015     * @param t the double to find the floor for
016     * @return the floor of t, as a long
017     */
018    public static long longFloor(double t) {
019        return t >= 0.0 ? (long) t : (long) t - 1L;
020    }
021    /**
022     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)}, but takes a float and returns a long.
023     * Doesn't consider weird floats like INFINITY and NaN.
024     *
025     * @param t the double to find the floor for
026     * @return the floor of t, as a long
027     */
028    public static long longFloor(float t) {
029        return t >= 0f ? (long) t : (long) t - 1L;
030    }
031    /**
032     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)} , but returns an int.
033     * Doesn't consider weird doubles like INFINITY and NaN.
034     * @param t the float to find the floor for
035     * @return the floor of t, as an int
036     */
037    public static int fastFloor(double t) {
038        return t >= 0.0 ? (int) t : (int) t - 1;
039    }
040    /**
041     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)}, but takes a float and returns an int.
042     * Doesn't consider weird floats like INFINITY and NaN.
043     * @param t the float to find the floor for
044     * @return the floor of t, as an int
045     */
046    public static int fastFloor(float t) {
047        return t >= 0f ? (int) t : (int) t - 1;
048    }
049    /**
050     * Like {@link Math#ceil(double)}, but returns an int.
051     * Doesn't consider weird doubles like INFINITY and NaN.
052     * @param t the float to find the ceiling for
053     * @return the ceiling of t, as an int
054     */
055    public static int fastCeil(double t) {
056        return t >= 0.0 ? -(int) -t + 1: -(int)-t;
057    }
058    /**
059     * Like {@link Math#ceil(double)}, but takes a float and returns an int.
060     * Doesn't consider weird floats like INFINITY and NaN.
061     * @param t the float to find the ceiling for
062     * @return the ceiling of t, as an int
063     */
064    public static int fastCeil(float t) {
065        return t >= 0f ? -(int) -t + 1: -(int)-t;
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Cubic-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
070     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively. Somewhat faster than
071     * quintic interpolation ({@link #querp(double, double, double)}), but slower (and smoother) than
072     * {@link  #lerp(double, double, double)}.
073     * @param start a valid double
074     * @param end a valid double
075     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
076     * @return a double between start and end inclusive
077     */
078    public static double cerp(final double start, final double end, double a) {
079        return (1.0 - (a *= a * (3.0 - 2.0 * a))) * start + a * end;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Cubic-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
084     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively. Somewhat faster than
085     * quintic interpolation ({@link #querp(float, float, float)}), but slower (and smoother) than
086     * {@link #lerp(float, float, float)}.
087     * @param start a valid float
088     * @param end a valid float
089     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
090     * @return a float between start and end inclusive
091     */
092    public static float cerp(final float start, final float end, float a) {
093        return (1f - (a *= a * (3f - 2f * a))) * start + a * end;
094    }
095    /*
096     * Quintic-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
097     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively.
098     * @param start a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
099     * @param end a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
100     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
101     * @return a double between x and y inclusive
102     */
103    public static double querp(final double start, final double end, double a){
104        return (1.0 - (a *= a * a * (a * (a * 6.0 - 15.0) + 10.0))) * start + a * end;
105    }
106    /*
107     * Quintic-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
108     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively.
109     * @param start a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
110     * @param end a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
111     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
112     * @return a float between x and y inclusive
113     */
114    public static float querp(final float start, final float end, float a){
115        return (1f - (a *= a * a * (a * (a * 6f - 15f) + 10f))) * start + a * end;
116    }
117
118
119    /**
120     * Linear-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
121     * @param start a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
122     * @param end a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
123     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
124     * @return a double between x and y inclusive
125     */
126    public static double lerp(final double start, final double end, final double a) {
127        return (1.0 - a) * start + a * end;
128    }
129
130    /**
131     * Linear-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
132     * @param start a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
133     * @param end a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
134     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
135     * @return a float between x and y inclusive
136     */
137    public static float lerp(final float start, final float end, final float a) {
138        return (1f - a) * start + a * end;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Given a float {@code a} from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a float that adjusts a to be closer to the
143     * end points of that range (if less than 0.5, it gets closer to 0.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
144     * @param a a float between 0.0f and 1.0f inclusive
145     * @return a float between 0.0f and 1.0f inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
146     */
147    public static double emphasize(final double a)
148    {
149        return a * a * (3.0 - 2.0 * a);
150    }
151    /**
152     * Given a float {@code a} from -1.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a float that adjusts a to be closer to the
153     * end points of that range (if less than 0, it gets closer to -1.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
154     * <br>
155     * Used by {@link ClassicNoise} and {@link  JitterNoise} to increase the frequency of high and low results, which
156     * improves the behavior of {@link Ridged2D} and other Ridged noise when it uses those noise algorithms.
157     * @param a a float between -1.0f and 1.0f inclusive
158     * @return a float between -1.0f and 1.0f inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
159     */
160    public static double emphasizeSigned(double a)
161    {         
162        a = a * 0.5 + 0.5;
163        return a * a * (6.0 - 4.0 * a) - 1.0;
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Given a double {@code a} from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a double that adjusts a to be much closer to
168     * the end points of that range (if less than 0.5, it gets closer to 0.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
169     * @param a a double between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
170     * @return a double between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
171     */
172    public static double extreme(final double a)
173    {
174        return a * a * a * (a * (a * 6 - 15) + 10);
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Given a double {@code a} from -1.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a double that adjusts a to be much closer
179     * to the end points of that range (if less than 0, it gets closer to -1.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
180     * @param a a double between -1.0 and 1.0 inclusive
181     * @return a double between -1.0 and 1.0 inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
182     */
183    public static double extremeSigned(double a)
184    {
185        a = a * 0.5 + 0.5;
186        return a * a * a * (a * (a * 12 - 30) + 20) - 1.0;
187    }
188
189    public interface Noise1D {
190        double getNoise(double x);
191        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed);
192    }
193
194    public interface Noise2D {
195        double getNoise(double x, double y);
196        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed);
197    }
198
199    public interface Noise3D {
200        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z);
201        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed);
202    }
203
204    public interface Noise4D {
205        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w);
206        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed);
207    }
208
209    public interface Noise5D {
210        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u);
211        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, long seed);
212    }
213
214    public interface Noise6D {
215        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v);
216        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed);
217    }
218
219    public static class Layered1D implements Noise1D {
220        protected int octaves;
221        protected Noise1D basis;
222        public double frequency;
223        public double lacunarity;
224        public Layered1D() {
225            this(Basic1D.instance);
226        }
227
228        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis) {
229            this(basis, 2);
230        }
231
232        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
233            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
234        }
235        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
236            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
237        }
238        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
239            this.basis = basis;
240            this.frequency = frequency;
241            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
242            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
243        }
244
245
246        @Override
247        public double getNoise(double x) {
248            x *= frequency;
249            int s = 1;
250            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
251            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
252                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6)) * s;
253            }
254            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
255        }
256
257        @Override
258        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
259            x *= frequency;
260            int s = 1;
261            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
262            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
263                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
264            }
265            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
266        }
267    }
268
269    public static class Layered2D implements Noise2D {
270        protected int octaves;
271        protected Noise2D basis;
272        public double frequency;
273        public double lacunarity;
274        public Layered2D() {
275            this(SeededNoise.instance);
276        }
277
278        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis) {
279            this(basis, 2);
280        }
281
282        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves) {
283            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
284        }
285        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
286            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
287        }
288        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
289            this.basis = basis;
290            this.frequency = frequency;
291            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
292            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
293        }
294
295        @Override
296        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
297            x *= frequency;
298            y *= frequency;
299            int s = 1;
300            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
301            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
302                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7)) * s;
303            }
304            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
305        }
306
307        @Override
308        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
309            x *= frequency;
310            y *= frequency;
311            int s = 1;
312            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
313            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
314                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
315            }
316            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
317        }
318    }
319    public static class Layered3D implements Noise3D {

321        protected Noise3D basis;
322        public double frequency;
323        public double lacunarity;

325            this(SeededNoise.instance);
326        }

329            this(basis, 2);
330        }

334        }

336            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
337        }
338        public Layered3D(Noise3D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
339            this.basis = basis;
340            this.frequency = frequency;
341            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
342            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
343        }
344
345        @Override
346        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
347            x *= frequency;
348            y *= frequency;
349            z *= frequency;
350            int s = 1;
351            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
352            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
353                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)) * s;
354            }
355            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
356        }
357
358        @Override
359        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
360            x *= frequency;
361            y *= frequency;
362            z *= frequency;
363            int s = 1;
364            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
365            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
366                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
367            }
368            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
369        }
370    }
371    public static class Layered4D implements Noise4D {
372        protected int octaves;
373        protected Noise4D basis;
374        public double frequency;
375        public double lacunarity;
376        public Layered4D() {
377            this(SeededNoise.instance);
378        }
379
380        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis) {
381            this(basis, 2);
382        }
383
384        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves) {
385            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
386        }
387        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
388            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
389        }
390        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
391            this.basis = basis;
392            this.frequency = frequency;
393            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
394            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
395        }
396
397        @Override
398        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w) {
399            x *= frequency;
400            y *= frequency;
401            z *= frequency;
402            w *= frequency;
403            int s = 1;
404            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
405            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
406                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8), w * i_s + (o << 9)) * s;
407            }
408            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
409        }
410
411        @Override
412        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed) {
413            x *= frequency;
414            y *= frequency;
415            z *= frequency;
416            w *= frequency;
417            int s = 1;
418            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
419            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
420                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s, w * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
421            }
422            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
423        }
424    }
425    public static class Layered5D implements Noise5D {
426        protected int octaves;
427        protected Noise5D basis;
428        public double frequency;
429        public double lacunarity;
430        public Layered5D() {
431            this(SeededNoise.instance);
432        }
433
434        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis) {
435            this(basis, 2);
436        }
437
438        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves) {
439            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
440        }
441        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
442            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
443        }
444        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
445            this.basis = basis;
446            this.frequency = frequency;
447            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
448            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
449        }
450
451        @Override
452        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u) {
453            x *= frequency;
454            y *= frequency;
455            z *= frequency;
456            w *= frequency;
457            u *= frequency;
458            int s = 1;
459            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
460            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
461                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
462                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10)) * s;
463            }
464            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
465        }
466
467        @Override
468        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, long seed) {
469            x *= frequency;
470            y *= frequency;
471            z *= frequency;
472            w *= frequency;
473            u *= frequency;
474            int s = 1;
475            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
476            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
477                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
478                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
479            }
480            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
481        }
482    }

484    public static class Layered6D implements Noise6D {
485        protected int octaves;
486        protected Noise6D basis;
487        public double frequency;
488        public double lacunarity;
489        public Layered6D() {
490            this(SeededNoise.instance);
491        }
492
493        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis) {
494            this(basis, 2);
495        }
496
497        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves) {
498            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
499        }
500        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
501            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
502        }
503        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
504            this.basis = basis;
505            this.frequency = frequency;
506            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
507            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
508        }
509
510        @Override
511        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
512            x *= frequency;
513            y *= frequency;
514            z *= frequency;
515            w *= frequency;
516            u *= frequency;
517            v *= frequency;
518            int s = 1;
519            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
520            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
521                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
522                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10), v * i_s + (o << 11)) * s;
523            }
524            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
525        }
526
527        @Override
528        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
529            x *= frequency;
530            y *= frequency;
531            z *= frequency;
532            w *= frequency;
533            u *= frequency;
534            v *= frequency;
535            int s = 1;
536            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
537            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
538                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
539                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, v * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
540            }
541            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
542        }
543    }
544
545    public static class Warped1D extends Layered1D {
546        public Warped1D() {
547            this(Basic1D.instance);
548        }
549
550        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis) {
551            this(basis, 2);
552        }
553
554        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
555            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
556        }
557        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
558            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
559        }
560        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
561            this.basis = basis;
562            this.frequency = frequency;
563            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
564            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
565        }
566
567
568        @Override
569        public double getNoise(double x) {
570            x *= frequency;
571            int s = 1;
572            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity, prev = 0.0;
573            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
574                n += (prev = basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6) + prev * 0.25)) * s;
575            }
576            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
577        }
578
579        @Override
580        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
581            x *= frequency;
582            int s = 1;
583            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity, prev = 0.0;
584            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
585                n += (prev = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + prev * 0.25, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L))) * s;
586            }
587            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
588        }
589    }

847    public static class InverseLayered1D implements Noise1D {
848        protected int octaves;
849        protected Noise1D basis;
850        public double frequency;
851        /**
852         * A multiplier that affects how much the frequency changes with each layer; the default is 0.5 .
853         */
854        public double lacunarity = 0.5;
855        public InverseLayered1D() {
856            this(Basic1D.instance);
857        }
858
859        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis) {
860            this(basis, 2);
861        }
862
863        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
864            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
865        }
866        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
867            this.basis = basis;
868            this.frequency = frequency;
869            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
870        }
871        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity){
872            this(basis, octaves, frequency);
873            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
874        }
875
876        @Override
877        public double getNoise(double x) {
878            x *= frequency;
879            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
880            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
881            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
882                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6)) * s;
883            }
884            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
885        }
886
887        @Override
888        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
889            x *= frequency;
890            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
891            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
892            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
893                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
894            }
895            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
896        }
897    }

1142            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
1143        }
1144        public InverseLayered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
1145            this.basis = basis;
1146            this.frequency = frequency;
1147            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1148        }
1149        public InverseLayered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity){
1150            this(basis, octaves, frequency);
1151            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
1152        }
1153
1154        @Override
1155        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
1156            x *= frequency;
1157            y *= frequency;
1158            z *= frequency;
1159            w *= frequency;
1160            u *= frequency;
1161            v *= frequency;
1162            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
1163            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
1164            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
1165                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
1166                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10), v * i_s + (o << 11)) * s;
1167            }
1168            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
1169        }
1170
1171        @Override
1172        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
1173            x *= frequency;
1174            y *= frequency;
1175            z *= frequency;
1176            w *= frequency;
1177            u *= frequency;
1178            v *= frequency;
1179            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
1180            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
1181            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
1182                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
1183                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, v * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
1184            }
1185            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
1186        }
1187    }
1188

1543    public static class Ridged1D implements Noise1D {
1544        protected int octaves;
1545        public double frequency;
1546        protected double correct;
1547        protected Noise1D basis;
1548
1549        public Ridged1D() {
1550            this(Basic1D.instance, 2, 1.25);
1551        }
1552
1553        public Ridged1D(Noise1D basis) {
1554            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1555        }
1556
1557        public Ridged1D(Noise1D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1558            this.basis = basis;
1559            this.frequency = frequency;
1560            setOctaves(octaves);
1561        }
1562
1563        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1564        {
1565            this.octaves = (octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves)));
1566            correct = 1.0;
1567            for (int o = 1; o < octaves; o++) {
1568                correct += Math.pow(2.0, -o);
1569            }
1570            correct = 2.0 / correct;
1571        }
1572
1573        @Override
1574        public double getNoise(double x) {
1575            double sum = 0, amp = 1.0;
1576            x *= frequency;
1577            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1578                double n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6));
1579                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1580                sum += amp * n;
1581                amp *= 0.5;
1582                x *= 2.0;
1583            }
1584            return sum * correct - 1.0;
1585        }
1586
1587        @Override
1588        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
1589            double sum = 0, amp = 1.0;
1590            x *= frequency;
1591            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1592                double n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1593                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1594                sum += amp * n;
1595                amp *= 0.5;
1596                x *= 2.0;
1597            }
1598            return sum * correct - 1.0;
1599        }
1600    }
1601
1602    public static class Ridged2D implements Noise2D {
1603        protected int octaves;
1604        public double frequency;
1605        protected double correct;
1606        protected Noise2D basis;
1607
1608        public Ridged2D() {
1609            this(SeededNoise.instance, 2, 1.25);
1610        }
1611
1612        public Ridged2D(Noise2D basis) {
1613            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1614        }
1615
1616        public Ridged2D(Noise2D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1617            this.basis = basis;
1618            this.frequency = frequency;
1619            setOctaves(octaves);
1620        }
1621
1622        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1623        {
1624            this.octaves = (octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves)));
1625            correct = 1.0;
1626            for (int o = 1; o < octaves; o++) {
1627                correct += Math.pow(2.0, -o);
1628            }
1629            correct = 2.0 / correct;
1630        }
1631
1632
1633        @Override
1634        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
1635            double sum = 0, amp = 1.0;
1636            x *= frequency;
1637            y *= frequency;
1638            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1639                double n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6), y + (i << 7));
1640                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1641                sum += amp * n;
1642                amp *= 0.5;
1643                x *= 2.0;
1644                y *= 2.0;
1645            }
1646            return sum * correct - 1.0;
1647        }
1648
1649        @Override
1650        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
1651            double sum = 0, amp = 1.0;
1652            x *= frequency;
1653            y *= frequency;
1654            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1655                double n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1656                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1657                sum += amp * n;
1658                amp *= 0.5;
1659                x *= 2.0;
1660                y *= 2.0;
1661            }
1662            return sum * correct - 1.0;
1663        }
1664    }
1665
1666    public static class Ridged3D implements Noise3D {
1667        protected int octaves;
1668        public double frequency;
1669        protected double correct;
1670        protected Noise3D basis;
1671        public Ridged3D() {
1672            this(SeededNoise.instance, 2, 1.25);
1673        }
1674
1675        public Ridged3D(Noise3D basis) {
1676            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1677        }
1678
1679        public Ridged3D(Noise3D basis, int octaves) {
1680            this(basis, octaves, 1.25);
1681        }
1682        public Ridged3D(Noise3D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1683            this.basis = basis;
1684            this.frequency = frequency;
1685            setOctaves(octaves);
1686        }
1687        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1688        {
1689            this.octaves = (octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves)));
1690            correct = 1.0;
1691            for (int o = 1; o < octaves; o++) {
1692                correct += Math.pow(2.0, -o);
1693            }
1694            correct = 2.0 / correct;
1695        }
1696
1697        @Override
1698        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
1699            double sum = 0, amp = 1.0;
1700            x *= frequency;
1701            y *= frequency;
1702            z *= frequency;
1703            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1704                double n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6), y + (i << 7), z + (i << 8));
1705                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1706                sum += amp * n;
1707                amp *= 0.5;
1708                x *= 2.0;
1709                y *= 2.0;
1710                z *= 2.0;
1711            }
1712            return sum * correct - 1.0;
1713        }
1714
1715        @Override
1716        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
1717            double sum = 0, amp = 1.0;
1718            x *= frequency;
1719            y *= frequency;
1720            z *= frequency;
1721            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1722                double n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1723                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1724                sum += amp * n;
1725                amp *= 0.5;
1726                x *= 2.0;
1727                y *= 2.0;
1728                z *= 2.0;
1729            }
1730            return sum * correct - 1.0;
1731        }
1732    }

1734
1735    public static class Ridged4D implements Noise4D {
1736        public double[] exp;
1737        protected int octaves;
1738        public double frequency, correct;
1739        public Noise4D basis;
1740
1741        public Ridged4D() {
1742            this(SeededNoise.instance, 2, 1.25);
1743        }
1744
1745        public Ridged4D(Noise4D basis) {
1746            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1747        }
1748
1749        public Ridged4D(Noise4D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1750            this.basis = basis;
1751            this.frequency = frequency;
1752            setOctaves(octaves);
1753        }
1754        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1755        {
1756            this.octaves = (octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves)));
1757            exp = new double[octaves];
1758            double maxvalue = 0.0;
1759            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1760                maxvalue += (exp[i] = Math.pow(2.0, -i));
1761            }
1762            correct = 2.0 / maxvalue;
1763        }
1764
1765        @Override
1766        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w) {
1767            double sum = 0.0, n;
1768            x *= frequency;
1769            y *= frequency;
1770            z *= frequency;
1771            w *= frequency;
1772            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1773                n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6), y + (i << 7), z + (i << 8), w + (i << 9));
1774                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1775                sum += n * n * exp[i];
1776                x *= 2.0;
1777                y *= 2.0;
1778                z *= 2.0;
1779                w *= 2.0;
1780            }
1781            return sum * correct - 1.0;
1782        }
1783
1784        @Override
1785        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed) {
1786            double sum = 0, n;
1787            x *= frequency;
1788            y *= frequency;
1789            z *= frequency;
1790            w *= frequency;
1791            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; ++i) {
1792                n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1793                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1794                sum += n * n * exp[i];
1795                x *= 2.0;
1796                y *= 2.0;
1797                z *= 2.0;
1798                w *= 2.0;
1799            }
1800            return sum * correct - 1.0;
1801        }
1802    }

1961    public static class Turbulent2D implements Noise2D {
1962        protected int octaves;
1963        protected Noise2D basis, disturbance;
1964        public double frequency;
1965        public final double correct;
1966
1967        public Turbulent2D() {
1968            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
1969        }
1970
1971        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb) {
1972            this(basis, disturb, 1);
1973        }
1974
1975        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves) {
1976            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
1977        }
1978        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
1979            this.basis = basis;
1980            this.frequency = frequency;
1981            disturbance = disturb;
1982            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1983            correct = 1.0 / ((1 << this.octaves) - 1.0);
1984        }
1985
1986        @Override
1987        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
1988            x *= frequency;
1989            y *= frequency;
1990            x += disturbance.getNoise(x, y);
1991            int s = 1;
1992            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
1993            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
1994                i_s *= 0.5;
1995                n += basis.getNoise(x * i_s + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7)) * s;
1996            }
1997            return n * correct;
1998        }
1999
2000        @Override
2001        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
2002            x *= frequency;
2003            y *= frequency;
2004            x += disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, seed);
2005            int s = 1;
2006            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
2007            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
2008                i_s *= 0.5;
2009                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * i_s, y * i_s, seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * s;
2010            }
2011            return n * correct;
2012        }
2013    }

2187    public static class Viny2D implements Noise2D {
2188        protected int octaves;
2189        protected Noise2D basis, disturbance;
2190        public double frequency;
2191
2192        public Viny2D() {
2193            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
2194        }
2195
2196        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb) {
2197            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2198        }
2199
2200        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves) {
2201            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2202        }
2203        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2204            this.basis = basis;
2205            this.frequency = frequency;
2206            disturbance = disturb;
2207            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2208        }
2209
2210        @Override
2211        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
2212            x *= frequency;
2213            y *= frequency;
2214            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2215            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy;
2216            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2217                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2218                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2219                n += basis.getNoise(xx, yy) * s + disturbance.getNoise(xx, yy) * (s >>= 1);
2220            }
2221            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2222        }
2223
2224        @Override
2225        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
2226            x *= frequency;
2227            y *= frequency;
2228            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2229            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy;
2230            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2231                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2232                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2233                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, seed) * s + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, seed) * (s >>= 1);
2234            }
2235            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2236        }
2237    }
2238    public static class Viny3D implements Noise3D {
2239        protected int octaves;
2240        protected Noise3D basis, disturbance;
2241        public double frequency;
2242
2243        public Viny3D() {
2244            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
2245        }
2246
2247        public Viny3D(Noise3D basis, Noise3D disturb) {
2248            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2249        }
2250
2251        public Viny3D(Noise3D basis, Noise3D disturb, final int octaves) {
2252            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2253        }
2254        public Viny3D(Noise3D basis, Noise3D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2255            this.basis = basis;
2256            this.frequency = frequency;
2257            disturbance = disturb;
2258            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2259        }
2260
2261        @Override
2262        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
2263            x *= frequency;
2264            y *= frequency;
2265            z *= frequency;
2266            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2267            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz;
2268            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2269                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2270                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2271                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2272                n += basis.getNoise(xx, yy, zz) * s + disturbance.getNoise(xx, yy, zz) * (s >>= 1);
2273            }
2274            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2275        }
2276
2277        @Override
2278        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
2279            x *= frequency;
2280            y *= frequency;
2281            z *= frequency;
2282            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2283            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz;
2284            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2285                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2286                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2287                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2288                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2289                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, seed) * s + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, seed) * (s >>= 1);
2290            }
2291            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2292        }
2293    }

2321            y *= frequency;

2341            w *= frequency;

2343            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz, ww;
2344            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2345                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2346                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2347                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2348                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2349                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2350                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, ww, seed) * s + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, ww, seed) * (s >>= 1);
2351            }
2352            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2353        }
2354    }
2355    public static class Viny6D implements Noise6D {
2356        protected int octaves;
2357        protected Noise6D basis, disturbance;
2358        public double frequency;
2359        public Viny6D() {
2360            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
2361        }
2362
2363        public Viny6D(Noise6D basis, Noise6D disturb) {
2364            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2365        }
2366
2367        public Viny6D(Noise6D basis, Noise6D disturb, final int octaves) {
2368            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2369        }
2370        public Viny6D(Noise6D basis, Noise6D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2371            this.basis = basis;
2372            this.frequency = frequency;
2373            disturbance = disturb;
2374            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2375        }
2376        @Override
2377        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
2378            x *= frequency;
2379            y *= frequency;
2380            z *= frequency;
2381            w *= frequency;
2382            u *= frequency;
2383            v *= frequency;
2384            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2385            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv;
2386            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2387                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2388                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2389                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2390                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2391                uu = u * i_s + (o << 10);
2392                vv = v * i_s + (o << 11);
2393                n += basis.getNoise(xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv) * s + disturbance.getNoise(xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv) * (s >>= 1);
2394            }
2395            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2396        }
2397
2398        @Override
2399        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
2400            x *= frequency;
2401            y *= frequency;
2402            z *= frequency;
2403            w *= frequency;
2404            u *= frequency;
2405            v *= frequency;
2406            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2407            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv;
2408            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2409                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2410                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2411                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2412                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2413                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2414                uu = u * i_s + (o << 10);
2415                vv = v * i_s + (o << 11);
2416                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv, seed) * s + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv, seed) * (s >>= 1);
2417            }
2418            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2419        }
2420    }
2421
2422
2423    public static class Slick2D implements Noise2D {
2424        protected int octaves;
2425        protected Noise2D basis, disturbance;
2426
2427        public Slick2D() {
2428            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
2429        }
2430
2431        public Slick2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb) {
2432            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2433        }
2434
2435        public Slick2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves) {
2436            this.basis = basis;
2437            disturbance = disturb;
2438            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2439        }
2440
2441        @Override
2442        public double getNoise(final double x, final double y) {
2443            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0, xx, yy;
2444            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2445            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2446                xx = x * (i_s *= 0.5) + (o << 6);
2447                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2448                n += basis.getNoise(xx + disturbance.getNoise(x, y), yy) * s;
2449            }
2450            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2451        }
2452
2453        @Override
2454        public double getNoiseWithSeed(final double x, final double y, long seed) {
2455            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0, xx, yy;
2456
2457            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2458            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2459                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2460                xx = x * (i_s *= 0.5) + (o << 6);
2461                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2462                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, seed), yy, seed) * s;
2463            }
2464            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2465        }
2466    }

2506                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);

2573            disturbance = disturb;
2574            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2575        }
2576
2577        @Override
2578        public double getNoise(final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w, final double u, final double v) {
2579            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0, xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv;
2580            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2581            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2582                xx = x * (i_s *= 0.5) + (o << 6);
2583                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2584                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2585                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2586                uu = u * i_s + (o << 10);
2587                vv = v * i_s + (o << 11);
2588                n += basis.getNoise(xx + disturbance.getNoise(x, y, z, w, u, v), yy, zz, ww, uu, vv) * s;
2589            }
2590            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2591        }

2593        @Override
2594        public double getNoiseWithSeed(final double x, final double y, final double z, final double w, final double u, final double v, long seed) {
2595            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0, xx, yy, zz, ww, uu, vv;
2596            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2597            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2598                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2599                xx = x * (i_s *= 0.5) + (o << 6);
2600                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2601                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2602                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2603                uu = u * i_s + (o << 10);
2604                vv = v * i_s + (o << 11);
2605                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed), yy, zz, ww, uu, vv, seed) * s;
2606            }
2607            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2608        }
2609    }

2612    public static class Exponential1D implements Noise1D {
2613        protected Noise1D basis;
2614        protected double sharpness, adjustment;
2615        public Exponential1D() {
2616            this(Basic1D.instance);
2617        }
2618
2619        public Exponential1D(Noise1D basis) {
2620            this(basis, 0.125);
2621        }
2622        public Exponential1D(Noise1D basis, double sharpness) {
2623            this.basis = basis;
2624            this.sharpness = sharpness - fastFloor(sharpness) - 1.0;
2625            this.adjustment = 2.0 / Math.log1p(this.sharpness * 0.9999999999999999);
2626            this.sharpness *= 0.5;
2627        }
2628
2629
2630        @Override
2631        public double getNoise(double x) {
2632            return Math.log(1.0 + sharpness * (basis.getNoise(x) + 1.0)) * adjustment - 1.0;
2633        }
2634
2635        @Override
2636        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
2637            return Math.log(1.0 + sharpness * (basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, seed) + 1.0)) * adjustment - 1.0;
2638        }
2639    }
2640

2656        }

2661        }

2664        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {

2777    /**
2778     * Used to add an extra parameter to 3D noise, such as one based on rotation, time, or some non-spatial component.
2779     * Adding a sine wave as the {@link #w} value to a world made with 3D noise results in
2780     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/w55JXtX.gif">something that looks like this</a>.
2781     */
2782    public static class Adapted3DFrom4D implements Noise3D {
2783        protected Noise4D basis;
2784        public double w;
2785        public Adapted3DFrom4D() {
2786            this(ClassicNoise.instance);
2787        }
2788
2789        public Adapted3DFrom4D(Noise4D basis) {
2790            this.basis = basis;
2791        }
2792
2793        public double getW() {
2794            return w;
2795        }
2796
2797        public void setW(double w) {
2798            this.w = w;
2799        }
2800
2801        @Override
2802        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
2803            return basis.getNoise(x, y, z, w);
2804        }
2805
2806        @Override
2807        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
2808            return basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, seed);
2809        }
2810    }
2811
2812    /**
2813     * Used to add extra parameters to 3D noise, such as those based on rotation, time, or some non-spatial component.
2814     * Using {@link #setExtras(double)} to set {@link #w} and {@link #u} in a world made with 3D noise results in
2815     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/zN2OmWx.gif">something that looks like this</a>.
2816     */
2817    public static class Adapted3DFrom5D implements Noise3D {
2818        protected Noise5D basis;
2819        public double w, u;
2820        public Adapted3DFrom5D() {
2821            this(ClassicNoise.instance);
2822        }
2823
2824        public Adapted3DFrom5D(Noise5D basis) {
2825            this.basis = basis;
2826        }
2827
2828        public double getW() {
2829            return w;
2830        }
2831
2832        public void setW(double w) {
2833            this.w = w;
2834        }
2835
2836        public double getU() {
2837            return u;
2838        }
2839
2840        public void setU(double u) {
2841            this.u = u;
2842        }
2843
2844        /**
2845         * This sets the two extra noise parameters given one parameter, theta, which is treated as looping over a
2846         * circle of different w and u values, with one cycle equal to a change of 1.0 in theta.
2847         * @param theta only the fractional part matters; used to set both w and u. Cycles if it goes past an integer.
2848         */
2849        public void setExtras(double theta) {
2850            w = NumberTools.cos_(theta);
2851            u = NumberTools.sin_(theta);
2852        }
2853
2854        @Override
2855        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
2856            return basis.getNoise(x, y, z, w, u);
2857        }
2858
2859        @Override
2860        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
2861            return basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, u, seed);
2862        }
2863    }
2864
2865
2866        /**
2867     * Produces a 2D array of noise with values from -1.0 to 1.0 that is seamless on all boundaries.
2868     * Uses (x,y) order. Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2869     * If you need to call this very often, consider {@link #seamless2D(double[][], int, int)}, which re-uses the array.
2870     * @param width the width of the array to produce (the length of the outer layer of arrays)
2871     * @param height the height of the array to produce (the length of the inner arrays)
2872     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2873     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2874     * @return a freshly-allocated seamless-bounded array, a {@code double[width][height]}.
2875     */
2876    public static double[][] seamless2D(final int width, final int height, final int seed, final int octaves) {
2877        return seamless2D(new double[width][height], seed, octaves);
2878    }
2879
2880    /**
2881     * Fills the given 2D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2882     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x or y axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2883     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2884     * @param fill a 2D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[width][height]} or something similar
2885     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2886     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2887     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2888     */
2889    public static double[][] seamless2D(final double[][] fill, final int seed, final int octaves) {
2890        return seamless2D(fill, seed, octaves, SeededNoise.instance);
2891    }
2892
2893    public static double total;
2894    /**
2895     * Fills the given 2D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2896     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x or y axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2897     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise. DOES NOT clear the values in fill, so if it already has non-zero
2898     * elements, the result will be different than if it had been cleared beforehand. That does allow you to utilize
2899     * this method to add multiple seamless noise values on top of each other, though that allows values to go above or
2900     * below the normal minimum and maximum (-1.0 to 1.0).
2901     * @param fill a 2D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[width][height]} or something similar
2902     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2903     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2904     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2905     */
2906    public static double[][] seamless2D(final double[][] fill, long seed, final int octaves, final Noise.Noise4D generator) {
2907        final int height, width;
2908        if (fill == null || (width = fill.length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0].length) <= 0
2909                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
2910            return fill;
2911        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height;
2912        int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2913        total = 0.0;
2914        double p, q,
2915                ps, pc,
2916                qs, qc,
2917                i_s = 0.5 / s;
2918        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2919            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2920            i_s *= 2.0;
2921            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2922                p = x * i_w;
2923                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
2924                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
2925                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2926                    q = y * i_h;
2927                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
2928                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
2929                    fill[x][y] += generator.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qc, qs, seed) * s;
2930                }
2931            }
2932        }
2933        i_s = 1.0 / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2934        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2935            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2936                total += (fill[x][y] *= i_s);
2937            }
2938        }
2939        return fill;
2940    }
2941
2942    /**
2943     * Produces a 3D array of noise with values from -1.0 to 1.0 that is seamless on all boundaries.
2944     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2945     * Because most games that would use this would use it for maps, and maps are often top-down, the returned 3D array
2946     * uses the order (z,x,y), which allows a 2D slice of x and y to be taken as an element from the top-level array.
2947     * If you need to call this very often, consider {@link #seamless3D(double[][][], long, int)}, which re-uses the
2948     * array instead of re-generating it.
2949     * @param width the width of the array to produce (the length of the middle layer of arrays)
2950     * @param height the height of the array to produce (the length of the innermost arrays)
2951     * @param depth the depth of the array to produce (the length of the outermost layer of arrays)
2952     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2953     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2954     * @return a freshly-allocated seamless-bounded array, a {@code double[depth][width][height]}.
2955     */
2956    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final int depth, final int width, final int height, final long seed, final int octaves) {
2957        return seamless3D(new double[depth][width][height], seed, octaves);
2958    }
2959
2960    /**
2961     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2962     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2963     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2964     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
2965     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2966     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2967     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2968     */
2969    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final double[][][] fill, final long seed, final int octaves) {
2970        return seamless3D(fill, seed, octaves, SeededNoise.instance);
2971    }
2972
2973    /**
2974     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2975     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2976     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2977     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
2978     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2979     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2980     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2981     */
2982    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final double[][][] fill, long seed, final int octaves, final Noise.Noise6D generator) {
2983        final int depth, height, width;
2984        if(fill == null || (depth = fill.length) <= 0 || (width = fill[0].length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0][0].length) <= 0
2985                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
2986            return fill;
2987        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height, i_d = 6.283185307179586 / depth;
2988        int s = 1<<(octaves-1);
2989        total = 0.0;
2990        double p, q, r,
2991                ps, pc,
2992                qs, qc,
2993                rs, rc, i_s = 0.5 / s;
2994        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s>>=1) {
2995            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2996            i_s *= 2.0;
2997            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2998                p = x * i_w;
2999                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
3000                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
3001                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3002                    q = y * i_h;
3003                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
3004                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
3005                    for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3006                        r = z * i_d;
3007                        rs = NumberTools.sin(r) * i_s;
3008                        rc = NumberTools.cos(r) * i_s;
3009                        fill[z][x][y] += generator.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qc, qs, rc, rs, seed) * s;
3010                    }
3011                }
3012            }
3013        }
3014        i_s = 1.0 / ((1<<octaves) - 1.0);
3015        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3016            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3017                for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3018                    total += (fill[z][x][y] *= i_s);
3019                }
3020            }
3021        }
3022        return fill;
3023    }
3024
3025    /**
3026     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
3027     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
3028     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
3029     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
3030     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
3031     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
3032     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
3033     */
3034    public static float[][][] seamless3D(final float[][][] fill, long seed, final int octaves) {
3035        final int depth, height, width;
3036        if(fill == null || (depth = fill.length) <= 0 || (width = fill[0].length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0][0].length) <= 0
3037                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
3038            return fill;
3039        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height, i_d = 6.283185307179586 / depth;
3040        int s = 1<<(octaves-1);
3041        double p, q, r,
3042                ps, pc,
3043                qs, qc,
3044                rs, rc, i_s = 0.5 / s;
3045        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s>>=1) {
3046            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
3047            i_s *= 2.0;
3048            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3049                p = x * i_w;
3050                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
3051                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
3052                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3053                    q = y * i_h;
3054                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
3055                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
3056                    for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3057                        r = z * i_d;
3058                        rs = NumberTools.sin(r) * i_s;
3059                        rc = NumberTools.cos(r) * i_s;
3060                        fill[z][x][y] += SeededNoise.noise(pc, ps, qc, qs, rc, rs, seed) * s;
3061                    }
3062                }
3063            }
3064        }
3065        i_s = 1.0 / ((1<<octaves) - 1.0);
3066        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3067            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3068                for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3069                    fill[z][x][y] *= i_s;
3070                }
3071            }
3072        }
3073        return fill;
3074    }
3075
3076    /**
3077     * Like {@link #seamless2D(double[][], long, int, Noise4D)}, but this produces 1D noise that "tiles" by repeating
3078     * its output every {@code sizeX} units that {@code x} increases or decreases by. This doesn't precalculate an
3079     * array, instead calculating just one value so that later calls with different x will tile seamlessly.
3080     * <br>
3081     * Internally, this just samples out of a circle from a source of 2D noise.
3082     * @param noise a Noise2D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3083     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3084     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3085     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3086     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3087     */
3088    public static double seamless1D(Noise2D noise, double x, double sizeX, long seed)
3089    {
3090        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3091        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), seed);
3092    }
3093
3094    /**
3095     * Like {@link #seamless2D(double[][], long, int, Noise4D)}, but this doesn't precalculate noise into an array,
3096     * instead calculating just one 2D point so that later calls with different x or y will tile seamlessly.
3097     * @param noise a Noise4D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3098     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3099     * @param y the y-coordinate to sample
3100     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3101     * @param sizeY the range of y to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3102     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3103     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3104     */
3105    public static double seamless2D(Noise4D noise, double x, double y, double sizeX, double sizeY, long seed)
3106    {
3107        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3108        y *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeY;
3109        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), NumberTools.cos(y), NumberTools.sin(y),
3110                seed);
3111    }
3112
3113
3114    /**
3115     * Like {@link #seamless3D(double[][][], long, int, Noise6D)}, but this doesn't precalculate noise into an array,
3116     * instead calculating just one 3D point so that later calls with different x, y, or z will tile seamlessly.
3117     * @param noise a Noise6D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3118     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3119     * @param y the y-coordinate to sample
3120     * @param z the z-coordinate to sample
3121     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3122     * @param sizeY the range of y to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3123     * @param sizeZ the range of z to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3124     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3125     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3126     */
3127    public static double seamless3D(Noise6D noise, double x, double y, double z, double sizeX, double sizeY, double sizeZ, long seed)
3128    {
3129        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3130        y *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeY;
3131        z *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeZ;
3132        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), NumberTools.cos(y), NumberTools.sin(y),
3133                NumberTools.cos(z), NumberTools.sin(z), seed);
3134    }
3135
3136    /**
3137     * A very simple 1D noise implementation, because a full-blown Perlin or Simplex noise implementation is probably
3138     * overkill for 1D noise. This does produce smoothly sloping lines, like Simplex noise does for higher dimensions.
3139     * The shape of the line varies over time, but <a href="https://i.imgur.com/83R3WLN.png">can look like this</a>.
3140     * If you give this a seed with {@link #getNoiseWithSeed(double, long)} instead of using {@link #getNoise(double)},
3141     * it will use a small extra step to adjust the spacing of peaks and valleys based on the seed, so getNoiseWithSeed
3142     * is slower than getNoise. If you use any Noise classes like {@link Noise.Layered1D}, they should use a seed anyway
3143     * because different octaves won't have different enough shapes otherwise.
3144     */
3145    public static class Basic1D implements Noise1D
3146    {
3147        public static final Basic1D instance = new Basic1D();
3148        public double alter1, alter2, alter3, alter4;
3149        public long lastSeed;
3150        public Basic1D()
3151        {
3152            this(1L);
3153        }
3154        public Basic1D(long seed)
3155        {
3156            lastSeed = seed;
3157            alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54;
3158            alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53;
3159            alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53;
3160            alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3161        }
3162        @Override
3163        public double getNoise(double x) {
3164            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3165                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3166                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3167                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3168        }
3169
3170        @Override
3171        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
3172            if(lastSeed != seed)
3173            {
3174                lastSeed = seed;
3175                alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54;
3176                alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53;
3177                alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53;
3178                alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3179            }
3180            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3181                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3182                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3183                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3184        }
3185        public static double cubicSway(double value)
3186        {
3187            long floor = (value >= 0.0 ? (long) value : (long) value - 1L);
3188            value -= floor;
3189            floor = (-(floor & 1L) | 1L);
3190            return value * value * (3.0 - 2.0 * value) * (floor << 1) - floor;
3191        }
3192
3193        public static double noise(double x, long seed) {
3194            final double
3195                    alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54, 
3196                    alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53, 
3197                    alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53, 
3198                    alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3199            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3200                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3201                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3202                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3203        }
3204    }
3205    public static class Sway1D implements Noise1D
3206    {
3207        public static final Sway1D instance = new Sway1D();
3208        public long seed;
3209        public Sway1D()
3210        {
3211            seed = 0L;
3212        }
3213        public Sway1D(long seed)
3214        {
3215            this.seed = seed;
3216        }
3217
3218        @Override
3219        public double getNoise(double x) {
3220            return NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed, x);
3221        }
3222
3223        @Override
3224        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
3225            return NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed, x);
3226        }
3227    }
3228    public static class Sway2D implements Noise2D

3239        }

3259//                    adjust1 = NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed + 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L, x * 0.25 + y * -1.75) + 1.,
3260//                    adjust2 = NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed - 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L, x + y) + 1.;

3264//                    + NumberTools.swayRandomized(seed + 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L, x - y) * adjust2 
3265//                    ) * 0.75 + 0.5);
3266            final long floorX = x >= 0.0 ? (long) x : (long) x - 1L,
3267                    floorY = y >= 0.0 ? (long) y : (long) y - 1L;
3268//            long seedX = seed * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL + floorX * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL,
3269//                    seedY = seed * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL + floorY * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;

3273//                    endY = (((seedY += 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL) ^ (seedY >>> 25)) * (seedY | 0xA529L));

3277//                    x1y1 = (int) (endX + endY >>> 56);
3278            final int x0y0 = HastyPointHash.hash256(floorX, floorY, seed),
3279                    x1y0 = HastyPointHash.hash256(floorX+1, floorY, seed),
3280                    x0y1 = HastyPointHash.hash256(floorX, floorY+1, seed),

3294//                    + (x * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x1y0][0] + iy * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x1y0][1])
3295//                    + (ix * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x0y1][0] + y * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x0y1][1])
3296//                    + (x * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x1y1][0] + y * SeededNoise.phiGrad2[x1y1][1])
3297//            );
3298            return ((SeededNoise.grad2d[x0y0][0] + SeededNoise.grad2d[x0y0][1]) * (ix * iy)
3299                    + (SeededNoise.grad2d[x1y0][0] + SeededNoise.grad2d[x1y0][1]) * (x * iy)
3300                    + (SeededNoise.grad2d[x0y1][0] + SeededNoise.grad2d[x0y1][1]) * (ix * y)
3301                    + (SeededNoise.grad2d[x1y1][0] + SeededNoise.grad2d[x1y1][1]) * (x * y)
3302            ) * 0.7071067811865475;
3303//            long xf = x >= 0.0 ? (long) x : (long) x - 1L;
3304//            long yf = y >= 0.0 ? (long) y : (long) y - 1L;
3305//            long s = ((0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL ^ seed ^ yf)) * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL, s2 = ((0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL ^ seed ^ yf + 1L)) * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
3306//            double xSmall = x - xf;
3307//            //, 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L, 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L

3313////                    x1y0 = HastyPointHash.hashAll(xf+1L, yf, seed) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63,

3315////                    x1y1 = HastyPointHash.hashAll(xf+1L, yf+1L, seed) * 0x0.fffffffffffffbp-63, y0, y1;
3316//            xSmall = xSmall * xSmall * (3.0 - 2.0 * xSmall);
3317////            double a2 = xSmall * xSmall, a4 = a2 * a2, a6 = a4 * a2;
3318////            xSmall = 0x1.c71c71c71c71cp-2 * a6 + -0x1.e38e38e38e38ep0 * a4 + 0x1.38e38e38e38e4p1 * a2;
3319////            y0 = (1.0 - xSmall) * x0y0 + xSmall * x1y0;
