3339
3340    /**
3341     * A hybrid between value and gradient noise that may be faster for 1D noise. Every integer value of x given to this
3342     * will produce a result of 0. This only hashes one coordinate per noise call, unlike most value noise that needs 2
3343     * hashes in 1D and many more in higher dimensions. Based on <a href="https://www.shadertoy.com/view/3sd3Rs">Inigo
3344     * Quilez' "Basic Noise"</a>.
3345     */
3346    public static class QuilezNoise implements Noise1D, Noise2D {
3347
3348        public long seed;
3349        public QuilezNoise() {
3350            this(0xB0BAFE77L);
3351        }
3352
3353        public QuilezNoise(long seed) {
3354            this.seed = seed;
3355        }
3356        @Override
3357        public double getNoise(double x) { 
3358            return getNoiseWithSeed(x, seed);
3359        }
3360//            xFloor = (xFloor ^ xFloor << 7 ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
3361//            xFloor = (xFloor ^ xFloor >>> 41 ^ xFloor >>> 23) * (xFloor ^ xFloor >> 25 | 1) >>> 32;
3362//            final double h = xFloor * 0x1p-28 - 4.0;
3363//            seed = (seed ^ xFloor ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L; // XLCG, helps randomize upper bits
3364//            // this next 'h' part finishes randomizing (not amazing quality, but fast), uses only the upper bits,
3365//            // and reduces it to a double between -8.0 and almost 8.0.
3366//            final double h = ((seed ^ seed >>> 26) * (seed | 0xA529) >>> 32) * 0x1p-28 - 8.0;
3367
3368        @Override
3369        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, final long seed) {
3370            x += ((seed & 0xFFFFFFFFL) ^ (seed >>> 32)) * 0x1p-24; // offset x by between 0.0 and almost 256.0
3371            final long xFloor = x >= 0.0 ? (long) x : (long) x - 1, // floor of x as a long
3372                    rise = 1L - ((x >= 0.0 ? (long) (x * 2.0) : (long) (x * 2.0) - 1) & 2L); // either 1 or -1
3373            x -= xFloor;
3374            // and now we flip the switch from "magic" to "more magic..."
3375            // this directly sets the bits that describe a double. this might seem like it should be slow; it is not.
3376            // seed and xFloor are XORed to roughly mix them together; adding would work too probably.
3377            // the two huge longs don't really matter except for their last digits:
3378            // the one that uses ^ must end in 5 or D (both hex) 
3379            // the one that uses * must end in 3 or B (both hex)
3380            // and that makes this a valid "XLCG," a cousin of the commonly used LCG random number generator.
3381            // it improves the randomness in the upper bits more than the lower ones, where the upper bits will become
3382            // more significant decimal places in the resulting double.
3383            // we unsigned-right-shift by 12, which puts the random bits all in the double's mantissa (which is how far
3384            // it is between the previous power of two and next power of two, roughly).
3385            // we bitwise OR with 0x4030000000000000L, which is the exponent section for a double between 16.0 and 32.0.
3386            // we work our magic and convert the bits to double.
3387            // subtracting 24.0 takes the range to -4.0 to 12.0, where we want it (Quilez used this).
3388            final double h = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble((seed ^ xFloor ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L >>> 12 | 
3389                      0x4040000000000000L) - 52.0;
3390//                    0x4030000000000000L) - 20.0;
3391            // Quilez' quartic curve; uses the "rise" calculated earlier to determine if this is on the rising or
3392            // the falling side. Uses that complicated "h" as the height of the peak or valley in the middle.
3393            return rise * x * (x - 1.0) * (h * x * (x - 1.0) - 1.0);
3394        }
3395
3396        @Override
3397        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
3398            return getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, seed);
3399        }
3400
3401        @Override
3402        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
3403            double n = 0.0;
3404            for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
3405                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
3406                double xEdit = x += (((seed & 0x55555555L) | (seed >>> 32 & 0xAAAAAAAAL))) * 0x1p-29 + 0.5698402909980532;
3407                double yEdit = y += (((seed & 0xAAAAAAAAL) | (seed >>> 32 & 0x55555555L))) * 0x1p-29 + 0.7548776662466927;
3408                final long
3409                        xFloor = xEdit >= 0.0 ? (long) xEdit : (long) xEdit - 1,
3410                        yFloor = yEdit >= 0.0 ? (long) yEdit : (long) yEdit - 1;
3411                xEdit -= xFloor;
3412                yEdit -= yFloor;
3413                xEdit *= (xEdit - 1.0);
3414                yEdit *= (yEdit - 1.0);
3415                final double m = (xEdit + yEdit) * 0.5;
3416                final double h = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble(HastyPointHash.hashAll(xFloor, yFloor, seed) >>> 12 | 0x4040000000000000L) - 52.0;
3417//            final double i = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble((~seed + yFloor ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L >>> 12 | 0x4030000000000000L) - 24.0;
3418                n += (m * (h * m - 1.0));
3419            }
3420            return n * 0.25;
3421////                    cerp(
3422//                    0.5 * (
3423//                            (xRise * m * (h * m - 1.0)) +
3424//                            (yRise * m * (i * m - 1.0))
3425//                    );
3426//                            //, 0.5 + (y - x) * 0.5);
3427        }
3428
3429    }
